document.docAuthor: Qiu, Jian-Yue, Xu, Hao & Chen, Li
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic review of the Oriental flower beetle Coilodera penicillata species complex (Coleoptera: Scarabaeidae: Cetoniinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic review of the Oriental flower beetle Coilodera penicillata species complex (Coleoptera: Scarabaeidae: Cetoniinae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Coelodera penicillata formosana Moser
:
Mikšić 1972 : 703
, fig. 20;
Mikšić 1976 : 271
, fig. 33a;
Miyake et al. 1991
: 39
;
Yu et al. 1998
: 101
, 180, plate 6, figs. 1a ♂ , 1b ♀ .

Coelodera penicillata
(nec Hope):
Kobayashi 1980 : 20
(misapplication of the name).

Macronota hopponus
Niijima & Kinoshita, 1923 : 232
(type locality: Hoppo, Formosa [=Peipu, Hsinchu Hsien, Taiwan), plate. I, fig. 12. Synonymized with
C. penicillata
by
Miwa & Chûjô 1939 : 83
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. See remarks of
C. penicillata
.

Type material. Syntype of
Coilodera formosana
labeled: Formosa, Tainan [handwriting on pale yellow label] /
formosana Mos.
Type [handwriting of Moser on pale yellow label] / Type [red label] /
subsp. formosana Mos.
[handwriting of Moser on pale yellow label] (female, MFNB, Figs. 45–46 ).

Comments on type material. The sex, number, and collecting site of the type series of
Coilodera formosana
were not mentioned in the original publication ( Moser 1910 ). Therefore, it was difficult to determine whether other specimens from Formosa in MFNB were included in the type series, and only the single female with a handwritten identification label of Moser here regard as syntype.

The type specimens (one male and three female) of
Macronota hopponus Niijima & Mastumura, 1923
are housed in EIHU (Dr. Masahiro Ohara, personal communication, September 2014 ) and unavailable for study at present.

Other material examined ( 11♂♂ , 24♀♀ ).

Distribution. This species is endemic to the island of Taiwan .

Natural history. A newly emerged adult of this species was recorded in the wood-feeding cockroach galleries of
Salganea raggei
(Blattaria: Blaberidae : Panesthiinae ) (
Kon et al. 2003
).

Remarks. The larvae morphology of
Coilodera formosana
and seven other species of Taenioderini were presented in detail in
Vendl et al. (2014)
, which is the first study on the immature stages of this tribe.
